content: This PR by @Monica Omar defines the map unitary R →* (R ≃⋆ₐ[S] R) that sends u to the map x ↦ u * x * star u. There are some minor formatting issues that I haven't raised, because I first want to see what the community thinks about this PR.
what do you think about the PR? :eyes:
@Monica Omar I don't really work in star-algebra; it might make the context clearer if you could tell us about some potential applications in mind, if you have any; I think the PR is fine

There are a lot of potential applications. Hmm I guess, the first thing to come to mind is that this map is surjective when R = Matrix n n \bbk, i.e., any star-algebra automorphism in Matrix n n \bbk is unitarily inner (equal to Unitary.toStarAlgAut u for some unitary u).
bijective, even? would you like to add that to the PR description?
Not bijective, no. I guess "almost injective", i.e., toStarAlgAut u = toStarAlgAut v iff u = α v for some scalar α.
ah, ok
and alpha would have to be an n-th root of unity?
It would just need to satisfy star u * v = \alpha 1 since it would be in the center.
@Kenny Lau when R is a C⋆-algebra, these are exactly the inner ⋆-automorphisms of the algebra, so it's a very natural concept. Note that since u is unitary, star u = u⁻¹, so this is just u * x * u⁻¹.
Here's a fun statement which is independent of ZFC: every automorphism of the Calkin algebra (the quotient of H →L[ℂ] H by the ideal of compact operators, where H is a Hilbert space) is inner.

I guess the one question we need to answer for this PR is what we should name the map. Is Unitary.toStarAlgAut clear enough?
See Eric's comment here: https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/29028#discussion_r2323329687
maybe we can call it inner or innerStarAlgEquiv?
I think conj was suggested in the comments
Maybe. I called it Unitary.toStarAlgAut because of docs#MulSemiringAction.toAlgAut

Eric's right here, this should be unitary.conjStarAlgAut, at least for now. There's no reason to be vague about which automorphism we're picking, even if it is standard. If we ever delete the existing Mul instance for StarAlgEquiv in favor of a type synonym (like MulAut), then it should should take values in that type instead, and it can be called StarAlgAut.conj. The analogy with MulSemiringAction.toAlgAut doesn't work as well because this doesn't work for an arbitrary group action or something similar; you need unitaries.
this is some sort of conjugation I saw it in the QCD
what's the QCD?
it's in the formula for changing your colors in quantum chromodynamics
the gluon field(s) undergoes a rotation that looks like this
and it cancels out with the corresponding rotation of the quark fields in the lagrangian so you have local SU(3) symmetry
Ah, I see, I see :nod:

(There is often a sign issue in the definition of the conjugation, and I was worried about one thing, the place of the u and the u star in the defining formula, but since this is multiplicative in u, the formula is correct!)
Ah, @Kenny Lau, one immediate application we can already do is change docs#Matrix.IsHermitian.spectral_theorem to use this map: Unitary.conjStarAlgAut hA.eigenvectorUnitary (diagonal ...)
hmm, that won't be in simpNF tho
but yes please put that in the PR description

It's not a simp theorem tho? Plus it avoids the coercions which could be a good thing. I'm not saying we should, just saying we could.
Oh, we definitely should. (in a separate PR)
